body:
I just tested it, it seems to only remove the folder from Syncthing (without removing the `.stfolder` file).
I definitely agree it should be more specific.

In English I'd expect `Remove` or `Remove from Syncthing` and similarly in German `Entfernen` or `Aus Syncthing entfernen`. The current `Delete`/`LÃ¶schen` button seems to imply (more) data loss.

Delete and remove are synonyms. :) Other languages might have better defined distinctions though, you're very welcome to jump in on Transifex and change / propose an update.

@jpjp I know that you know what it does so the question is rhetorical, but deleting is anyway distinct from un-sharing. But the share relationships certainly bears clarifying, and should editable on both sides (i.e. the device side as well as the folder side...).

@calmh yep I know what it does :) But I was looking at the button through the scared new eyes of a new user. I think "remove" implies "remove from set" and "delete" implies "delete from filesystem" tbh, but a button with a clearer explanation would be better.

Yeah, thing is though, with the current (new and shiny!) terminology "Remove Folder" sounds even more like it would nuke it from disk. "Remove Folder From Syncthing Without Deleting Anything From Disk" doesn't fit. :( (And would probably be a short novel in German or Swedish...)
Ah.

Could add a note underneath it or something though.

```
[Remove]
(Removing a folder does not remove files on disk)
```
Well I can't think of better words!
Just `Stop sharing`
Isn't that what happens when you deselect devices to share it with, though?
Well, but this is on a more global level I guess.
"Remove from sync"?
Remove from Syncthing, Do not sync...
Disconnect from Sync

Abandon Folder :smile: 
Dismiss Folder

Remove (without folder) sounds to me like it fits the actual behaviour best or at least a lot better than delete. If you want to choose something different for the sake of the folder terminology, I'd prefer "Stop syncing" or "Stop sharing".

For usability I'd put the discription of the actual behaviour in the mouseover text or a JS hover action.
No need to clutter the UI when people don't think about this button.
Detach?
+1 for "Remove"  or "Detach"
"Remove (without folder)" doesn't make much sense to me. "Stop sharing is better" but has the issue that calmh raised. "Detach" won't mean anything to a normal user.
+1 for "Delete" and info "Deleting a folder does not remove files on disk"

Wow, adding that really looks like crap. This dialog needs some serious help. :/

![screen shot 2014-11-27 at 10 50 27](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/125426/5215003/41b2f6d6-7623-11e4-8ef4-b9f03e93fb6d.png)

Maybe show the info only on mouseover?

Other than that, I still like "Remove from sync" better, and it would take up less space than the info does if always shown.

Yeah I think "remove" instead of delete would lower the amount of confused users a lot.
Also putting this in a hovertext should help too.
Remove from sync sounds good.
Detach is nice, short and doesn't imply deleting anything.
